title: Sign on enthalpy + entropy - K decreases at high T

content.description: A student observes that the equilibrium constant for a reaction is greater than <math alttext="1.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> at temperatures below <math alttext="500 Kelvin " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> but less than <math alttext="1.0" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1.0</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> at temperatures above <math alttext="500 Kelvin " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What can the student conclude about the values of <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction? (Assume that <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are independent of temperature.)

choices.label: <math alttext="delta H naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta S naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta S naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta S naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta H naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta S naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta H naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta S naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
